Here is the Python code: ```python import re def extract_bold_text(file_path): with open(file_path, 'r') as file: content = file.read() # Regular expression to find bold text (either denoted by * or _) bold_text_pattern = r'\*([^*]+)\*|\*([_]+)?\*|_{1,2}([^_]*)_{1,2}' # Find all matches of the bold text pattern bold_texts = re.findall(bold_text_pattern, content) # Print each match separated by a newline for bold_text in bold_texts: print(''.join(bold_text)) print(' ') # Test the function with your input file path extract_bold_text('your-input-file-path.org') ``` Replace `'your-input-file-path.org'` with the actual path to your input file. This script will print all bold texts in the file, each on a separate line.This problem is a natural language processing (NLP) problem. We can use Python's NLTK library to solve this problem. The steps we will follow are: 1. Load the text into the program. 2. Tokenize the text, which means split the text into individual words. 3. Use a part-of-speech tagger to label each word with its corresponding part of speech (POS). We'll use the NLTK pos_tag function for this. 4. Identify bolded words by checking if their POS tag includes 'BIGDEC' (which stands for bolded declension). 5. Print out all bolded words.
